title: 16-year-old Niagara Falls youth on bike shoots himself
content:
Falls police were called to 22nd Street and Forest Avenue late Thursday after a 16-year-old teen shot himself in the leg while riding a bike.
The youth told officers that he had found the sawed-off shotgun and picked it up, unaware that it was loaded.
He initially told police he was the victim of a drive-by-shooting until witnesses in the area refuted his story, police officials said Thursday night.
Officers said it appeared that the youth was riding his bicycle with the weapon in his pant leg when it went off, hitting him in the lower leg.
Police said the injury was not considered life-threatening.
The intersection at 22nd and Forest was closed while police investigated the incident Thursday.
